Title: Japan must avoid issuing debt to fund fresh spending, IMF says
Description: Japan must fund any additional spending plans within its budget rather than issuing more debt, the International Monetary Fund said on Friday, urging the government to get its fiscal house in order as the central bank starts to raise interest rates.

Title: Kamala Harris says Trump's comment on women 'is offensive to ever...
Description: Kamala Harris said Thursday that Donald Trump’s comment that he would protect women whether they 'like it or not' shows that the Republican presidential nominee does not understand women’s rights 'to make decisions about their own lives, including their own bodies.'

Title: Spain searches for bodies after unprecedented flooding claims at ...
Description: Crews searched for bodies in stranded cars and sodden buildings Thursday as residents salvaged what they could from their ruined homes following monstrous flash floods in Spain that claimed at least 158 lives, with 155 deaths confirmed in the eastern Valencia region alone.

Title: N. Korea says it successfully test-fired new Hwasong-19 ICBM
Description: North Korea said Friday it successfully test-fired the new Hwasong-19 intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) the previous day, with its leader Kim Jong-un saying the country has secured an 'irreversible' status of developing delivery means of nuclear weapons.

Title: Zelenskyy expects N. Korean troops to engage with Ukrainian force...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said North Korean troops deployed to Russia are expected to engage with Ukrainian forces in a few days, a media interview showed Thursday.

Title: How NK's deployment of troops to Russia could impact peace on Kor...
Description: There is increasing evidence that North Korea has sent troops to Russia for possible deployment in Ukraine, a move that could further escalate the war in Ukraine and ratchet up tensions on the Korean Peninsula.

Title: As US election nears, Harris, Trump policy visions come into rene...
Description: With the U.S. presidential election just 10 days away, global attention is turning to outlooks for America's post-election foreign policy that would affect its alliance with South Korea, approach to an intransigent North Korea and strategic competition with China to name a few.

Title: N. Korea claims S. Korean drone took off from western border isla...
Description: North Korea said Monday that its analysis of the flight log of a drone that crashed in Pyongyang earlier this month showed it took off from a South Korean border island in the Yellow Sea, insisting that the South Korean military is behind what it claimed were South Korea's drone incursions.

Title: Michelle Obama backs Harris in Michigan, where Trump courts Musli...
Description: Republican Donald Trump appealed to Muslim voters in Michigan on Saturday as Michelle Obama made an impassioned plea on behalf of Kamala Harris at the Democrat's own rally in the battleground state. In Michigan, Harris and Trump are battling for voters that include an Arab American and Muslim population concerned about Israel's bombardment of Gaza, and union workers worried about how electric vehicles could reshape the U.S. auto industry, which is headquartered in Detroit, the state's largest city. Election Day is Nov. 5 but early voting was under way in Michigan, as it is many states.

Title: S. Korea to hold int'l forum on N. Korea's human rights in Geneva...
Description: The unification ministry said Monday it will hold a two-day forum on North Korea's human rights situation in Switzerland this week ahead of the United Nations' review of the North's human rights record next month.

Title: TSMC suspended shipments to China firm after chip found on Huawei...
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company suspended shipments to China-based chip designer Sophgo after a chip it made was found on a Huawei AI processor, according to two people familiar with the matter.

Title: Zelenskyy says N. Korean troops in Russia may join battlefield 'i...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said his country could soon be forced to fight North Korean troops as they could join the battlefield against Ukraine 'in a matter of days.'

Title: Why not all BRICS players back Russia's bid for de-dollarized wor...
Description: Amid the unity on show in the Russian city of Kazan this week, BRICS leaders remained divided over the value of de-dollarization - a geopolitical difference that could become starker as the bloc expands, analysts said.

Title: NATO confirms N. Korea's troop deployment to join Russia's war in...
Description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) Secretary-General Mark Rutte confirmed Monday that North Korean troops have been deployed to Russia's Kursk region, a front-line area in its conflict with Ukraine.

Title: Elon Musk says real threat to democracy is people who accuse Trum...
Description: Tech mogul Elon Musk , speaking at a town hall Saturday night in Pennsylvania to support Republican Donald Trump , played down the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol and exhorted supporters to cast votes early in the presidential swing state while describing mail ballots as a 'recipe for fraud.'

Title: Abductee families' group to send leaflets to Pyongyang this week
Description: A group representing the families of those abducted by North Korea said Monday it would fly leaflets into North Korea this week, aiming to raise awareness about the abductee issue.

Title: Satellite photos show Israel hit Iran former nuclear weapons test...
Description: An American researcher said an Israeli airstrike on Saturday hit a building that was part of Iran's defunct nuclear weapons development program, and he and another researcher said facilities used to mix solid fuel for missiles also were struck.

Title: N. Korea's troop deployment in Russia-Ukraine war could happen 's...
Description: President Yoon Suk Yeol said Monday that North Korea's troop deployment in Russia's war with Ukraine could take place 'sooner than expected,' calling the latest development 'serious.'

Title: Washington Post says will not endorse Harris or Trump in election
Description: The influential Washington Post newspaper, owned by Amazon billionaire Jeff Bezos, announced Friday it will endorse neither Democrat Kamala Harris nor Republican Donald Trump in the U.S. presidential election.

Title: US says N. Korea has sent about 10,000 troops to eastern Russia
Description: North Korea has sent around 10,000 troops to eastern Russia, which will likely augment Russian forces near Ukraine 'over the next several weeks,' a U.S. National Security Council (NSC) official said Monday, as President Joe Biden called the deployment 'very dangerous.'

Title: Japan votes in election expected to punish PM Ishiba's coalition
Description: Japan's voters decide the fate of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's government on Sunday in an election expected to punish his coalition over a funding scandal and inflation, potentially ending a decade of dominance for his Liberal Democratic Party.

Title: Zelenskyy expects 12,000 NK soldiers in Russia 'soon'
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that he expects 12,000 North Korean soldiers on Russian territory 'soon,' as he met with Nordic leaders in Iceland.

Title: Netanyahu says 'precise' attack on Iran met Israel's aims
Description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that Israel's air attack on Iran was 'precise and powerful' and achieved all its goals.

Title: N. Korean foreign minister departs for Russia amid troop dispatch
Description: North Korean Foreign Minister Choe Son-hui has departed for Russia for an official visit, the North's state media reported Tuesday, in a visit that comes as the United States said the North sent about 10,000 soldiers to eastern Russia for training.

Title: Japan's ruling coalition set to lose parliamentary majority, exit...
Description: Japan's ruling coalition may fall short of a parliamentary majority, exit polls for Sunday's general election showed, raising uncertainty over the make-up of the government of the world's fourth-largest economy.

Title: N. Korean troops in Russia moving toward front lines with Ukraine...
Description: Some of the North Korean troops deployed to Russia seem to have been moving to the front lines with Ukraine, South Korea’s spy agency said, Tuesday, fueling speculation that North Korean troops’ direct involvement in the Russia-Ukraine war is imminent.

Title: Japan's government in flux after election gives no party majority
Description: The make-up of Japan's future government was in flux on Monday after voters punished Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's ruling coalition, leaving no party with a clear mandate to lead the world's fourth-largest economy.

Title: Small number of N. Korean troops already inside Ukraine: report
Description: A small number of North Korean troops are already in Ukraine, with the numbers expected to rise as North Korean forces finish training in eastern Russia and move toward the front lines of the war, a news report has said.

Title: Trump's New York rally attacks Harris, draws criticism
Description: Republican Donald Trump led a headline-grabbing New York rally on Sunday with nonstop attacks on Kamala Harris, but Democrats sought to capitalize on crude insults from some of his allies' opening speeches.

Title: N. Korea, Russia hold joint IT exhibition in Pyongyang for 1st ti...
Description: A joint exhibition aimed at promoting information technology exchanges between North Korea and Russia has opened in Pyongyang, the North's state media said Wednesday, marking their first such event in 18 years.

Title: Egypt proposes two-day Gaza truce in hope of full ceasefire
Description: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi on Sunday proposed a two-day truce in Gaza and limited hostage exchange aimed at securing 'a complete ceasefire' after more than a year of war between Israel and Hamas.

Title: N. Korean advance unit possibly deployed to Russia's front lines:...
Description: An advance team of North Korean troops may have been deployed to the front lines of Russia's war against Ukraine, South Korea's military intel agency said Wednesday.

Title: TSMC tech in Huawei's AI chips raises questions about 'porous' su...
Description: When a Canadian research firm found that Huawei Technologies' multi-chiplet artificial intelligence (AI) processor Ascend 910B contained dies made by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC), it shed light on possible loopholes in U.S. sanctions and China's persistent efforts to access advanced foundry technologies, according to analysts.

Title: N. Korea completes preparations to launch long-range missile: S. ...
Description: North Korea has completed preparations to launch a long-range missile and has put a mobile launcher in place, South Korea's military intelligence agency said Wednesday.

Title: Police out in force to prevent rowdy Halloween celebrations in Sh...
Description: Shanghai police patrolled the downtown streets over the weekend to crack down on Halloween celebrations in China's most international city. Local authorities appeared to be trying to prevent a repeat of last year, when Halloween revellers thronged central Shanghai, with some dressed in costumes that poked fun of the Chinese stock market, youth unemployment and strict COVID-19 policies.

Title: NK troops possibly deployed to front lines in Russia-Ukraine war:...
Description: The intelligence agencies of South Korea and the U.S. believe that some North Korean advance units may have been deployed to the front lines in the Russia-Ukraine war. Media reports even suggest that these units are already in Ukrainian territory, with some soldiers having been killed during battles.

Title: Greenhouse gases hit new record highs in 2023: UN
Description: Greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere reached new record highs in 2023, locking in future temperature increases for years to come, the United Nations warned Monday.

Title: N. Korea, Russia's FMs to hold strategic consultations in Moscow:...
Description: North Korea's foreign minister will hold strategic consultations with her Russian counterpart in Moscow, a news report showed Wednesday, amid concerns that the North's troops deployed to Russia may soon join combat in its war against Ukraine.

Title: Philippine ex-President Duterte says he kept 'death squad' as may...
Description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte told a Senate inquiry Monday that he had maintained a 'death squad' of gangsters to kill other criminals when he was mayor of a southern Philippine city.

Title: N. Korea's 8,400-strong hacking group escalates attacks on S. Kor...
Description: North Korea's state-sponsored cyberunit, comprising some 8,400 hackers, has mounted over 10,000 attacks against South Korea this year, South Korea's cyber operation command said Wednesday.

Title: No new limits on Ukraine's use of US arms if N. Korea joins Russi...
Description: The U.S. will not impose new limits on Ukraine's use of American weapons if North Korea joins Russia's war, the Pentagon said on Monday, as NATO said North Korean military units had been deployed to the Kursk region in Russia.

Title: Top security adviser calls N. Korea 'worst rogue group' over troo...
Description: National Security Adviser Shin Won-sik on Wednesday lambasted North Korea as the 'worst rogue group' for dispatching its troops to Russia, vowing to come up with 'all possible' response measures based on South Korea's alliance with the United States.

Title: US finalizes rules to curb AI investments in China, impose other ...
Description: The Biden administration said on Monday it is finalizing rules that will limit U.S. investments in artificial intelligence and other technology sectors in China that could threaten U.S. national security.

Title: N. Korea launches new solid-fuel ICBM ahead of US election
Description: North Korea fired what appeared to be a new type of solid-fuel intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) toward the East Sea on Thursday, South Korea's military said, in an apparent move aimed at flaunting its nuclear capabilities ahead of the U.S. presidential election next week.

Title: Thousands of Chinese kindergartens close as falling birthrate tak...
Description: The number of kindergartens in China dropped by more than 5 percent last year in the latest indicator of the country's falling birthrate.

Title: Reports on N. Korean troops 'mere assertions': Russian UN envoy
Description: Russia's ambassador to the U.N. on Wednesday brushed off reports that North Korean troops were present at its frontlines in the war against Ukraine, calling them 'mere assertions.'

Title: Outcry as Israel bans main UN Palestinian aid agency
Description: Israel's parliament on Monday approved a bill banning the main United Nations (U.N.) aid agency for the war-devastated Gaza Strip, sparking international outcry.

Title: NK leader says ICBM launch demonstrates 'counteraction will' agai...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un confirmed the launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) on Thursday, describing it as demonstrating the country's 'counteraction will' against its enemies.

Title: Indonesia's Prabowo to visit China and US in 1st foreign trip, ne...
Description: Indonesia President Prabowo Subianto will visit China and the United States during a five-country trip just a few weeks after taking office, Kompas newspaper reported on Tuesday, signalling his intent to pursue an active role on the international stage.

Title: Border residents block attempt to send anti-regime leaflets to No...
Description: Attempts by human rights activists to send leaflets critical of the North Korean regime across the inter-Korean border were thwarted, Thursday, by hundreds of residents and local officials who feared retaliatory actions from Pyongyang.

Title: Democrats escalate attacks on Trump after comedian calls Puerto R...
Description: Democrats stepped up their attacks on Donald Trump on Monday, a day after a comedian opening the former president's Madison Square Garden rally called Puerto Rico a 'floating island of garbage,' a comment that drew wide condemnation and highlighted the rising power of a key Latino group in the swing state of Pennsylvania.

Title: NK fires ICBM shortly after S. Korea, US warn against troop dispa...
Description: North Korea fired an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) toward the East Sea, Thursday, just hours after the defense ministers of both South Korea and the United States condemned Pyongyang's recent troop deployment to Russia.

Title: Hezbollah names deputy head Naim Qassem to succeed slain leader
Description: Lebanon's Hezbollah movement announced Tuesday it has chosen deputy head Naim Qassem to succeed Hasan Nasrallah as leader after his death in an Israeli strike on south Beirut last month.

Title: Satellite images show N. Korea dug large border trenches after de...
Description: Commercial satellite images reveal that North Korea has carved at least two large trenches across roads and rail lines on its heavily armed border with South Korea since it blew up the northern sections of cross-border routes earlier this month.

Title: Duterte’s jarring testimony into drug killings in Philippines rel...
Description: The cockiness, expletives and threats unleashed by former President Rodrigo Duterte in a Senate inquiry brought back the nightmare of the bloody 'war on drugs' for many families of the thousands of victims who were gunned down under his rule.

Title: Uyghur rights body meets in Bosnia under tight security over thre...
Description: A body fighting for Uyghur people's rights in China and abroad had to meet in virtual secrecy with police protection in the Bosnian capital after threats and pressure to cancel, it said.

Title: Steve Bannon released after serving 4 months in prison for contem...
Description: Longtime Donald Trump ally Steve Bannon was released from prison early Tuesday, after serving a four-month sentence for defying a subpoena in the congressional investigation into the U.S. Capitol attack on Jan. 6, 2021.

Title: Finland's president raises Ukraine war, security issues with Chin...
Description: Finnish President Alexander Stubb said he would discuss peaceful solutions to the war in Ukraine during his meeting on Tuesday with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing.

Title: Deadly Israeli strike in Gaza amid anger over UN agency ban
Description: An Israeli air strike on a single residential block killed nearly 100 people on Tuesday, Gaza's civil defense agency said, leaving rescuers scrambling for survivors as Israel pursued its offensives in Gaza and Lebanon.

Title: EU slaps tariffs on Chinese EVs, risking Beijing backlash
Description: The European Union has decided to increase tariffs on Chinese-built electric vehicles to as much as 45.3 percent at the end of its highest profile trade investigation that has divided Europe and prompted retaliation from Beijing.

Title: Chinese astronauts to conduct experiments in space, including lun...
Description: China sent three astronauts on Wednesday to its permanently inhabited space station, where they will conduct dozens of scientific experiments, some related to the construction of human habitats.

Title: Biden announces $3 bil. to reduce carbon emissions at US ports, '...
Description: The Biden administration is awarding nearly $3 billion to boost climate-friendly equipment and infrastructure at ports across the country, including Baltimore, where a bridge collapse killed six construction workers in March and disrupted East Coast shipping routes for months.

Title: How Donald Trump's rhetoric has grown darker and windier
Description: No scene has dominated U.S. politics since 2015 quite like Donald Trump on stage, waxing on for an hour-plus in front of a chorus of red 'Make America Great Again' hats.

Title: Flash floods in Spain sweep away cars, disrupt trains, leave seve...
Description: Several people were reported missing by Spanish authorities after flash floods swept cars through village streets and disrupted rail service in large areas of eastern and southern Spain on Tuesday.

Title: Support sinks for Japan coalition after election blow
Description: Support has sunk further for Japan's embattled ruling coalition, a new poll showed Wednesday, after Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's party suffered its worst election result in 15 years.

Title: Iran slams Germany, EU over criticism of dual national's executio...
Description: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi on Tuesday slammed his German counterpart Annalena Baerbock and EU chief Josep Borrell over their criticism of Iran's execution of Iranian-German Jamshid Sharmahd.

Title: Harris urges voters to reject Trump's efforts to sow division, fe...
Description: Kamala Harris stood before an overflowing crowd near the White House on Tuesday and promised Americans she would fight for them every day as she urged voters to reject Donald Trump’s efforts to sow division and fear, declaring, 'It doesn’t have to be this way.'

Title: A second high court rules that Japan's ban on same-sex marriage i...
Description: A second Japanese high court ruled Wednesday that the government's policy against same-sex marriage is unconstitutional, the latest in a series of decisions upholding plaintiffs' demands for marriage equality.

Title: Philippine police to investigate Duterte's 'death squad' claims
Description: The Philippine police said on Wednesday they will investigate revelations made by former President Rodrigo Duterte that he assembled a 'death squad' to control crime when he was mayor of the southern city of Davao.

Title: Russia asks at UN: If West aids Ukraine, why can't North Korea he...
Description: Russia's envoy to the United Nations on Wednesday questioned why its allies like North Korea could not help Moscow in its war against Ukraine given Western countries claim the right to help Kyiv.

Title: US 'strongly' condemns NK's ICBM test, vows to ensure security of...
Description: The United States 'strongly' condemns North Korea's test of an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) this week, a White House official said Wednesday, calling it a 'flagrant' breach of multiple U.N. Security Council resolutions.

Title: US consumers keep economy on solid ground ahead of election
Description: The U.S. economy grew solidly in the third quarter, with consumer spending increasing at its fastest pace in one and a half years and inflation slowing sharply, continuing to defy forecasts of a recession and outperforming its global peers ahead of the Nov. 5 presidential election.

Title: VW demands 10% wage cuts to save jobs as profits plunge
Description: Volkswagen asked its workers to take a 10-percent pay cut on Wednesday, arguing it was the only way that Europe's biggest carmaker could save jobs and remain competitive as profits plunged to a three-year low and union bosses threatened strikes.

Title: Spanish floods kill 95 as year of rain falls in a day in Valencia
Description: At least 95 people have been killed in possibly the deadliest flooding to hit Spain in its modern history after torrential rain battered the eastern region of Valencia, sweeping away bridges and buildings, local authorities said on Wednesday.

Title: Why Chinese internet users love APT, hit single by BLACKPINK's Ro...
Description: Chinese social media have given BLACKPINK's Rose's new hit single with Bruno Mars, 'APT,' the thumbs up, praising its catchy and uplifting tune.

Title: Britain identifies its first case of new mpox variant
Description: Britain has detected its first case of new mpox variant clade Ib, the country's health security agency (UKHSA) said on Wednesday, adding that the risk to the population remained low.

Title: China's Temu faces EU investigation into rogue traders, illegal g...
Description: Chinese online retailer Temu is facing a European Union investigation over suspicions it's failing to prevent the sale of illegal products, the 27-nation bloc's executive arm said on Thursday.

Title: Typhoon Kong-rey hits Taiwan's east coast, leaving 1 dead
Description: A powerful typhoon made landfall in Taiwan on Thursday, killing one person and bringing high winds and floods to much of the island’s east coast and northern areas, after barreling past the northern Philippines.

Description: Israel's parliament on Monday approved a bill banning the main United Nations (U.N.) aid agency for the war-devastated Gaza Strip, sparking international outcry.

Title: Some N. Korean generals, troops in Russia might move to front lin...
Description: Some North Korean generals and troops sent to Russia to support Moscow's war in Ukraine might have moved to the battlefield zones, South Korea's spy agency told lawmakers Tuesday.

Title: Thousands of Chinese kindergartens close as falling birthrate tak...
Description: The number of kindergartens in China dropped by more than 5 percent last year in the latest indicator of the country's falling birthrate.

Title: US finalizes rules to curb AI investments in China, impose other ...
Description: The Biden administration said on Monday it is finalizing rules that will limit U.S. investments in artificial intelligence and other technology sectors in China that could threaten U.S. national security.

Title: Zelenskyy expects 12,000 NK soldiers in Russia 'soon'
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that he expects 12,000 North Korean soldiers on Russian territory 'soon,' as he met with Nordic leaders in Iceland.

Title: N. Korean foreign minister departs for Russia

Title: US says N. Korea has sent about 10,000 troops to eastern Russia
Description: North Korea has sent around 10,000 troops to eastern Russia, which will likely augment Russian forces near Ukraine 'over the next several weeks,' a U.S. National Security Council (NSC) official said Monday, as President Joe Biden called the deployment 'very dangerous.'

Title: No new limits on Ukraine's use of US arms if N. Korea joins Russi...
Description: The U.S. will not impose new limits on Ukraine's use of American weapons if North Korea joins Russia's war, the Pentagon said on Monday, as NATO said North Korean military units had been deployed to the Kursk region in Russia.

Title: N. Korea's troop deployment in Russia-Ukraine war could happen 's...
Description: President Yoon Suk Yeol said Monday that North Korea's troop deployment in Russia's war with Ukraine could take place 'sooner than expected,' calling the latest development 'serious.'

Title: Abductee families' group to send leaflets to Pyongyang this week
Description: A group representing the families of those abducted by North Korea said Monday it would fly leaflets into North Korea this week, aiming to raise awareness about the abductee issue.

Title: NATO confirms N. Korea's troop deployment to join Russia's war in...
Description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) Secretary General Mark Rutte confirmed Monday that North Korean troops have been deployed to Russia's Kursk region, a front-line area in its conflict with Ukraine.

Title: Philippine ex-President Duterte says he kept 'death squad' as may...
Description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte told a Senate inquiry Monday that he had maintained a 'death squad' of gangsters to kill other criminals when he was mayor of a southern Philippine city.

Title: Greenhouse gases hit new record highs in 2023: UN
Description: Greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere reached new record highs in 2023, locking in future temperature increases for years to come, the United Nations warned Monday.

Title: Police out in force to prevent rowdy Halloween celebrations in Sh...
Description: Shanghai police patrolled the downtown streets over the weekend to crack down on Halloween celebrations in China's most international city. Local authorities appeared to be trying to prevent a repeat of last year, when Halloween revellers thronged central Shanghai, with some dressed in costumes that poked fun of the Chinese stock market, youth unemployment and strict COVID-19 policies.

Title: TSMC tech in Huawei's AI chips raises questions about 'porous' su...
Description: When a Canadian research firm found that Huawei Technologies' multi-chiplet artificial intelligence (AI) processor Ascend 910B contained dies made by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC), it shed light on possible loopholes in U.S. sanctions and China's persistent efforts to access advanced foundry technologies, according to analysts.

Title: Japan's government in flux after election gives no party majority
Description: The make-up of Japan's future government was in flux on Monday after voters punished Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's ruling coalition, leaving no party with a clear mandate to lead the world's fourth-largest economy.

Title: Trump's New York rally attacks Harris, draws criticism
Description: Republican Donald Trump led a headline-grabbing New York rally on Sunday with nonstop attacks on Kamala Harris, but Democrats sought to capitalize on crude insults from some of his allies' opening speeches.

Title: Egypt proposes two-day Gaza truce in hope of full ceasefire
Description: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi on Sunday proposed a two-day truce in Gaza and limited hostage exchange aimed at securing 'a complete ceasefire' after more than a year of war between Israel and Hamas.

Title: S. Korea to hold int'l forum on N. Korea's human rights in Geneva...
Description: The unification ministry said Monday it will hold a two-day forum on North Korea's human rights situation in Switzerland this week ahead of the United Nations' review of the North's human rights record next month.

Title: Russia sending 'mercenaries' from N. Korea to frontline in trucks...
Description: Russia is using civilian-plated trucks to transport 'mercenaries' from North Korea to a frontline area, Ukraine's military intelligence service has said, amid concerns over North Korean troops possibly joining combat in Russia's war on Ukraine.

Title: N. Korea claims S. Korean drone took off from western border isla...
Description: North Korea said Monday that its analysis of the flight log of a drone that crashed in Pyongyang earlier this month showed it took off from a South Korean border island in the Yellow Sea, insisting that the South Korean military is behind what it claimed were South Korea's drone incursions.

Title: Japan's ruling coalition set to lose parliamentary majority, exit...
Description: Japan's ruling coalition may fall short of a parliamentary majority, exit polls for Sunday's general election showed, raising uncertainty over the make-up of the government of the world's fourth-largest economy.

Title: Netanyahu says 'precise' attack on Iran met Israel's aims
Description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that Israel's air attack on Iran was 'precise and powerful' and achieved all its goals.

Title: How NK's deployment of troops to Russia could impact peace on Kor...
Description: There is increasing evidence that North Korea has sent troops to Russia for possible deployment in Ukraine, a move that could further escalate the war in Ukraine and ratchet up tensions on the Korean Peninsula.

Title: Japan votes in election expected to punish PM Ishiba's coalition
Description: Japan's voters decide the fate of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's government on Sunday in an election expected to punish his coalition over a funding scandal and inflation, potentially ending a decade of dominance for his Liberal Democratic Party.

Title: Washington Post says will not endorse Harris or Trump in election
Description: The influential Washington Post newspaper, owned by Amazon billionaire Jeff Bezos, announced Friday it will endorse neither Democrat Kamala Harris nor Republican Donald Trump in the U.S. presidential election.

Title: Elon Musk says real threat to democracy is people who accuse Trum...
Description: Tech mogul Elon Musk , speaking at a town hall Saturday night in Pennsylvania to support Republican Donald Trump , played down the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol and exhorted supporters to cast votes early in the presidential swing state while describing mail ballots as a 'recipe for fraud.'

Title: Satellite photos show Israel hit Iran former nuclear weapons test...
Description: An American researcher said an Israeli airstrike on Saturday hit a building that was part of Iran's defunct nuclear weapons development program, and he and another researcher said facilities used to mix solid fuel for missiles also were struck.

Title: Why not all BRICS players back Russia's bid for de-dollarized wor...
Description: Amid the unity on show in the Russian city of Kazan this week, BRICS leaders remained divided over the value of de-dollarization - a geopolitical difference that could become starker as the bloc expands, analysts said.

Title: TSMC suspended shipments to China firm after chip found on Huawei...
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company suspended shipments to China-based chip designer Sophgo after a chip it made was found on a Huawei AI processor, according to two people familiar with the matter.

Title: Michelle Obama backs Harris in Michigan, where Trump courts Musli...
Description: Republican Donald Trump appealed to Muslim voters in Michigan on Saturday as Michelle Obama made an impassioned plea on behalf of Kamala Harris at the Democrat's own rally in the battleground state. In Michigan, Harris and Trump are battling for voters that include an Arab American and Muslim population concerned about Israel's bombardment of Gaza, and union workers worried about how electric vehicles could reshape the U.S. auto industry, which is headquartered in Detroit, the state's largest city. Election Day is Nov. 5 but early voting was under way in Michigan, as it is many states.

Title: As US election nears, Harris, Trump policy visions come into rene...
Description: With the U.S. presidential election just 10 days away, global attention is turning to outlooks for America's post-election foreign policy that would affect its alliance with South Korea, approach to an intransigent North Korea and strategic competition with China to name a few.

Title: What we know about Israeli strikes on Iran
Description: Iran said Israeli air strikes targeting its military sites killed two soldiers on Saturday, after Israel said its warplanes carried out raids in retaliation for a missile barrage.

Title: At least 115 dead and missing in massive flooding and landslides ...
Description: The number of dead and missing in massive flooding and landslides wrought by Tropical Storm Trami in the Philippines has exceeded 100 and the president said Saturday that many areas remained isolated with people in need of rescue.

Title: Videos, satellite imagery show NK soldiers allegedly in Russia: r...
Description: More videos posted on social media and satellite imagery suggest that North Korean soldiers are at Russia's military training sites for possible deployment in the war in Ukraine, The Washington Post has reported.

Title: N. Korea slams Seoul-Washington joint air exercise
Description: North Korea lambasted South Korea and the United States on Saturday for staging a joint air exercise, accusing Washington of driving the Korean Peninsula into an 'uncontrollable' situation.

Title: Israel hits back at Iran with strikes on military targets: Israel...
Description: Israel hit back at Iran early on Saturday, with its military saying it was conducting strikes against military targets in response to Tehran's attacks on Israel.

Title: N. Korea says troop dispatch to Russia, if true, falls in line wi...
Description: North Korea's foreign ministry said Friday any alleged deployment of North Korean troops to Russia would align with international law, making the first official comment over the issue.

Title: Seoul urges Pyongyang to confirm status of S. Korean detainees
Description: The foreign ministry on Friday submitted a questionnaire to the United Nations human rights office, urging North Korea to disclose the whereabouts of South Korean detainees.

Title: Zelenskyy says Russia to deploy NK troops in combat zones Oct. 27...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Friday that Russia plans to deploy North Korean troops to the battlefield starting Oct. 27-28, citing intelligence reports.

Title: Russia says NK leader Kim's visit to Russia possible next year
Description: Russia said Friday that North Korean leader Kim Jong-un visiting Moscow next year is a possibility, noting that high-level exchanges are always taking place with Pyongyang as its 'close neighbor.'

Title: China welcomes Apple's continued, deeper presence
Description: U.S. tech giant Apple is welcome to continue deepening its presence in the Chinese market, Commerce Minister Wang Wentao told its Chief Executive Tim Cook during a meeting on Friday, the ministry said in a statement.

Title: N. Korea condemns G7 meeting of defense ministers
Description: North Korea on Friday denounced the latest meeting of defense ministers of the Group of Seven (G7), claiming what it called the 'war contractor group' took issue with North Korea's policy of nuclear forces.

Title: UN voices opposition to 'further militarization' of Ukraine confl...
Description: The United Nations Secretariat expressed its opposition Thursday to the 'further militarization' of the ongoing war in Ukraine amid growing concerns that North Korean troops could be deployed to support Russian forces in the armed conflict.

Title: Putin does not deny reports about North Korea troops
Description: President Vladimir Putin did not deny U.S. claims that North Korea had sent troops to Russia but said on Thursday it is up to Moscow how to run its mutual defence clause with Pyongyang and accused the West of escalating the Ukraine war.

Title: Samuel L. Jackson lauded at MoMA film benefit

Description: France pledged to provide a 100-million euro ($108 million) package to support Lebanon at an international conference Thursday, as President Emmanuel Macron said 'massive aid' is needed to support the country where war between Hezbollah militants and Israel has displaced a million people, killed over 2,500, and deepened an economic crisis.

Title: Japan's rising ramen prices give election voters food for thought

Title: Financial cooperation and BRICS expansion on the table as Putin h...
Description: Russia’s President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday hosted China’s Xi Jinping, India’s Narendra Modi and other world leaders at a summit of the BRICS bloc of developing economies, part of the Kremlin's efforts to challenge Western global clout.

Title: Hong Kong civil service restrictions on WhatsApp, WeChat needed i...

Description: North Korea is building unidentified structures on an eastern inter-Korean road that it blew up last week, a source said Thursday, amid heightened cross-border tensions over the North's border activities.

Description: South Korea's chief nuclear envoy has said the relations between Russia and North Korea are developing into a 'full-scale, escalating collusion,' calling for building 'irreversible' cooperation networks among like-minded countries to respond to the threats.

Title: What can UN do if North Korea sends troops to Ukraine?

Description: A senior U.S. administration official confirmed Wednesday that thousands of North Korean troops are in Russia 'to be trained,' while Washington does not know for what mission they were sent there.

Description: NATO countries have confirmed evidence that North Korea has sent troops to Russia, an alliance spokeswoman said Wednesday, warning it would be a major escalation if they head to Ukraine.

Title: US lab operator Quest Diagnostics to launch bird flu test at end ...

Title: N. Korea's stockpile of war materials expected to last up to 3 mo...
Description: North Korea is believed to have secured military supplies that could last up to three months in the event of a war and is running its munitions factories at full capacity to support Russia, a lawmaker said Wednesday.

Title: Apple CEO Tim Cook meets China's IT minister during Beijing visit...
Description: Apple CEO Tim Cook met on Wednesday with China's Minister for Industry and Information Technology Jin Zhuanglong during a visit to Beijing this week, the ministry said in a statement.

Title: Images capture exact moments Israeli missile strikes building in ...
Description: Taking cover behind a large tree, an Associated Press photographer pointed his camera toward a Beirut apartment building the Israeli military warned was in its sights.

Title: Another video of soldiers believed to be N. Koreans in Russia rel...
Description: Another video clip showing a group of soldiers believed to be North Koreans dispatched to Russia has been released on social media, amid claims that the North is sending its troops to join Russian forces in the war in Ukraine.

Title: TSMC told US of chip in Huawei product after TechInsights finding...
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company notified the U.S. that one of its chips had been found in a Huawei product after tech research firm TechInsights took apart the product, a person familiar with the matter said, revealing a possible violation of export restrictions on the Chinese company.

Title: Britain, Germany will sign a defense pact to counter Russia's gro...
Description: German submarine-hunting planes will patrol the North Atlantic from a base in Scotland under a new Britain-Germany defense pact in response to the growing threat from Russia, officials said.

Title: Putin hosts Global South leaders at BRICS summit meant to counter...
Description: China’s Xi Jinping, India’s Narendra Modi and other world leaders arrived Tuesday in the Russian city of Kazan for a summit of the BRICS bloc of developing economies that the Kremlin hopes to turn into a rallying point for defying Western influence in global affairs.

Title: E. coli outbreak tied to McDonald's Quarter Pounder kills 1, sick...

Description: Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris on Tuesday said she would work to bring more funds to community banks to help Latino men secure small business loans, while Republican Donald Trump's economic roundtable aimed at Latino voters devolved into a tirade of insults against his opponent.

Title: Blinken urges Israel to do more on Gaza humanitarian aid

Description: China's latest stimulus measures will not meaningfully boost domestic demand, leaving a major source of trade friction intact, U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and International Monetary Fund chief economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas said on Tuesday.

Title: Zelenskyy calls on allies 'not to hide', respond to North Korean ...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on allies on Tuesday 'not to hide' and to respond to evidence of North Korean involvement in Russia's war in Ukraine.

Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has once again called for enhancing the country's war deterrence, including the readiness of its nuclear capabilities, in response to what he described as growing nuclear threats from the United States, state media said Wednesday.

Title: Blinken arrives in Israel as US looks to renew cease-fire efforts...
Description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Israel on Tuesday on his 11th visit to the region since the outbreak of the Israel-Hamas war. The U.S. hopes to revive cease-fire efforts after the killing of top Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, but so far all the warring parties appear to be digging in.

Title: Germany identifies its first case of new mpox variant
Description: The first case of the new mpox variant has been detected in Germany, the Robert Koch Institute (RKI) for public health said on Tuesday, adding that it viewed the risk to the wider population as low.

Title: Yellen says isolationism 'made America and the world worse off' i...
Description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen is telling world financial leaders that the U.S. economy has grown stronger because the Biden administration rejected isolationism, offering a barely veiled criticism of former President Donald Trump’s policies two weeks before the U.S. election.

Title: NK leader's sister accuses S. Korea, Ukraine of provocation, like...
Description: The powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un slammed South Korea and Ukraine on Tuesday for what she claimed was a military provocation against Pyongyang, likening the two countries to 'bad dogs bred by the U.S.'

Description: The South Korean military failed to confirm whether underground facilities were demolished when North Korea disabled its guard posts (GPs) in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) in 2018, as part of an inter-Korean agreement, a declassified report showed Tuesday.

Title: 181 N. Korean defectors have entered S. Korea in 2024

Title: S. Korea hints at supplying offensive weapons to Ukraine
Description: South Korea urged North Korea to immediately withdraw its troops sent to Russia to support its invasion of Ukraine, labeling the deployment a grave security threat to the international community, the presidential office said Tuesday.

Title: China plans live-fire drills in Taiwan Strait after US and Canadi...
Description: China said it would carry out live-fire drills in the Taiwan Strait on Tuesday, two days after U.S. and Canadian warships sailed through the contentious waterway following Beijing's massive military exercise a week ago.

Title: China plans live-fire drills in Taiwan Strait after US and Canadi...
Description: China said it would carry out live-fire drills in the Taiwan Strait on Tuesday, two days after U.S. and Canadian warships sailed through the contentious waterway following Beijing's massive military exercise a week ago.

Title: Japan's general election outcome could muddle BOJ plans

Title: Elon Musk's $1 million election giveaway tests limits of election...
Description: Elon Musk’s $1 million giveaway for voters who sign his free-speech and gun-rights petition falls into a gray area of election law, and legal experts are divided about whether the billionaire supporter of Donald Trump could be running afoul of prohibitions on paying people to register to vote. The Tesla CEO is promising to give $1 million each day to a randomly selected person who signs his online petition pledging to support the First and Second amendments of the U.S. Constitution, which protect the rights to free speech and gun ownership.

Title: Blinken heads to Middle East for new cease-fire push as Israel st...
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken headed to the Middle East on Monday to launch another push for an elusive cease-fire, seeking to revive negotiations to end the Gaza war and defuse the spillover conflict in Lebanon.

Title: Harris, Trump pick up the pace two weeks to Election Day
Description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris and her Republican rival, Donald Trump, delivered radically different messages on the U.S. campaign trail on Monday as they sought to win over undecided voters in the two weeks before Election Day.

Title: NK leader calls for 'perfection' in reconstruction of homes in fl...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has called for 'perfection' in the reconstruction of homes in the flood-ravaged regions of the country's northwest, state media reported Tuesday.

Title: N. Korea spurns alleged troop dispatch to aid Russia in Ukraine a...
Description: North Korea on Monday dismissed as 'groundless rumors' the accusations from South Korea and Ukraine that it is sending soldiers to fight alongside Russia in the war in Ukraine, arguing that its relations with Moscow are 'legitimate and cooperative.'

Title: Russian, N. Korean flags displayed together on Ukraine battlefiel...
Description: A pro-Russia Telegram account has posted a photo showing the Russian and North Korean flags side by side on a Ukrainian battlefield, indicating that North Korea has likely sent troops to support Russia in its prolonged war with Ukraine.

Title: Yoon, British FM agree to cooperate against NK-Russia military co...
Description: President Yoon Suk Yeol met with British Foreign Secretary David Lammy on Monday to discuss strengthening security and defense industry cooperation amid deepening military ties between North Korea and Russia, Yoon's office said.

Title: Russia defends N. Korea ties, denies clarifying use of N. Korean ...
Description: Russia said on Monday it will continue its cooperation with North Korea but declined to comment on allegations that it plans to use North Korean soldiers in military operations against Ukraine.

Title: NATO chief shares concern over NK's troop dispatch to Russia in p...
Description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization Secretary General Mark Rutte said Monday he shared concerns with South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol regarding North Korea's preparations for troop dispatch to Russia during their phone talks.

Title: Brazil's Lula cancels BRICS trip after minor brain hemorrhage fro...
Description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Sunday canceled his trip to Russia for the BRICS summit, following medical advice to temporarily avoid long-haul flights after a head injury at home that caused a minor brain hemorrhage.

Title: Prabowo aims to boost Indonesia's energy security through oil and...
Description: Indonesia's new government aims to revive oil and gas production, with plans to cut regulations, reactivate idle wells and enhance output at producing assets in hopes of reversing a decades-long decline in output, officials have said.

Title: N. Korea keeps mum on its troop deployment to Russia

Title: UN chief seeks 'significant' funding at summit to save nature

Title: Moldovan president denounces 'unprecedented attack' on election

Title: Cuba grid collapses again as hurricane looms

Title: Trump hands out french fries in Pennsylvania, Harris visits Georg...
Description: With the U.S. presidential election little more than two weeks away, Democrat Kamala Harris visited two churches on Sunday while her Republican rival, Donald Trump, visited another kind of American temple: a McDonald's.

Title: Israel launches airstrikes on Beirut, saying it's targeting Hezbo...

Title: Indonesia's ban on Temu won't spread across Southeast Asia: analy...
Description: Indonesia's recent initiative to ban Temu, the popular discount-shopping platform run by Pinduoduo owner PDD Holdings, is not expected to be adopted by other economies in Southeast Asia over the near term, according to industry analysts.

Title: China's pro-birth policies not yet enough to counter demographic ...
Description: If China's fertility rate remains on its downward trajectory, for every newborn in the future, six people would die — a trend that threatens to intensify the nation's demographic crisis, a demographer has cautioned.

Title: Elon Musk's election promise of $1 million daily giveaway sparks ...
Description: Pennsylvania's Democratic governor, Josh Shapiro, on Sunday called on law enforcement to investigate billionaire Elon Musk for his promise at a weekend pro-Trump rally to give away $1 million each day until Election Day.

Title: Thousands join right-wing rally against Spanish government
Description: Thousands of people packed a Madrid square on Sunday to protest against Socialist Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez's government and demand an early election, at a rally backed by right-wing parties.

Title: Iraq's Kurdish region goes to the polls with a flagging economy a...
Description: Residents of Iraq’s semi-autonomous northern Kurdish region went to the polls in long-awaited parliamentary elections Sunday under the shadow of ongoing rivalries, economic instability , and unresolved disputes with Baghdad .

Title: Residents and activists in central Bosnia clean up a lake after m...
Description: Residents and activists on Sunday pulled out heaps of debris and trash from a lake in a central Bosnian region that was devastated by deadly floods and landslides more than two weeks ago.

Title: Elon Musk promises to award $1 mil. each day to a signer of his p...
Description: Billionaire Elon Musk promised on Saturday to give away $1 million each day until November's election to someone who signs his online petition supporting the U.S. Constitution.

Title: Cuba suffers third major setback in restoring power to island, mi...

Description: South Korea is facing a dilemma over whether to provide lethal weapons to Ukraine in its war against Russia, following confirmation that North Korea has deployed troops to support Russia.

Description: Video footage and documents revealed recently corroborate claims that North Korea has been deploying its troops to assist Russia in the ongoing war against Ukraine.

Title: China's pro-birth policies not yet enough to counter demographic ...
Description: If China's fertility rate remains on its downward trajectory, for every newborn in the future, six people would die - a trend that threatens to intensify the nation's demographic crisis, a demographer has cautioned.

Title: N. Korea accuses UN chief of 'double standards' over inter-Korean...
Description: North Korea accused U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres of 'double standards' Sunday, saying he urged Pyongyang to exercise restraint following its destruction of inter-Korean roads while remaining silent about South Korea's alleged drone infiltration into the North.

Title: Russia prepares Korean-language questionnaire for N. Korean soldi...
Description: Russia appears to have prepared a Korean-language questionnaire to facilitate the distribution of military equipment to North Korean soldiers deployed in its territory, CNN reported.

Title: Xi expresses willingness to promote regional, global peace in mes...
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has sent a message to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, expressing a willingness to move relations between the two countries further forward and to promote regional and global peace, Pyongyang's state media reported Sunday.

Title: US defense chief says NK troop deployment to Russia, if true, wou...
Description: U.S. Defense Secretary LLoyd Austin has said he cannot confirm North Korea's troop deployment to Russia, but if true, it would be concerning, according to a news report.

Title: N. Korea minister says new US-led sanctions monitoring team unlaw...
Description: North Korea's foreign minister said a new multilateral sanctions monitoring team led by the United States was 'utterly unlawful and illegitimate,' state media reported on Sunday.

Title: Israel PM says Hezbollah tried to 'assassinate' him with drone
Description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accused Iran-backed group Hezbollah of trying to kill him on Saturday, after his office said a drone from Lebanon hit the premier's family home.

Title: N. Korea sends more trash balloons toward S. Korea: JCS
Description: North Korea floated balloons likely carrying trash toward South Korea on Saturday, the South's military said, following a similar launch last week.

Title: Trump says he would impose tariffs on China if China went into Ta...
Description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said he would impose additional tariffs on China if China were to 'go into Taiwan,' the Wall Street Journal reported.

Title: China's Xi calls for troops to boost war preparedness
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping called this week for troops to strengthen their preparedness for war, state media reported on Saturday, just days after Beijing staged large-scale military drills around Taiwan.

Title: Harris, Trump barnstorm Michigan, spar over who has stamina
Description: Democrat Kamala Harris raised questions about Republican Donald Trump's physical stamina to serve effectively as president as the two rivals tore through the deadlocked battleground state of Michigan on Friday, with Trump lashing back about the energy he's shown on the campaign trail.

Title: Hamas mourns Sinwar, vows no hostage release until war ends
Description: Hamas vowed Friday not to release the hostages seized during its Oct. 7 attack on Israel until the Gaza war ends, as it mourned the death of its leader Yahya Sinwar.

Title: US 'highly concerned' over reported NK troop dispatch for Russia'...
Description: The United States is 'highly concerned' about North Korea's reported dispatch of troops to support Russia in its war against Ukraine, a White House official said Friday, noting that Washington will consult with allies on the implications of 'such a dramatic move' if the report is true.

Title: N. Korea claims discovering remains of drone sent from S. Korea i...
Description: North Korea claimed Saturday it has discovered remains of at least one drone sent from South Korea, describing it as the same type displayed on the South's Armed Forces Day in Seoul earlier this month.

Title: Video shows suspected NK soldiers readying for deployment in Russ...
Description: A video shared by a Ukrainian government-affiliated organization on Saturday showed what appeared to be North Korean soldiers preparing for deployment at a Russian military training center, amid growing concerns over the North's plan to send thousands of its soldiers to support Russia in the Ukraine war.

Title: NK troop deployment to Russia grave development in int'l security...
Description: North Korea's large-scale provision of troops to Russia in its war against Ukraine is seen as a grave development that could further destabilize the global security landscape marred by conflicts, as well as a blow to the fragile diplomatic ties between Seoul and Moscow.

Title: US to probe Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' system after pedestrian k...
Description: The U.S. government's road safety agency is investigating Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' system after getting reports of crashes in low-visibility conditions, including one that killed a pedestrian.

Title: N. Korea participates in Ukraine war, decides to dispatch 12,000 ...
Description: South Korea's spy agency said Friday it believes North Korea has decided to send large-scale troops to support Russia in its war against Ukraine and has already begun deployment.

Title: Hezbollah says it will escalate war with Israel after Hamas leade...
Description: Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group said on Friday it was moving to a new and escalating phase in its war against Israel while Iran said 'the spirit of resistance will be strengthened' after the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.
